snippet: Just as employers replaced pensions with retirement savings plans, more large companies appear to be making a similar cost-sharing shift with health plans.
abstract: More large companies appear to be implementing cost-sharing shift with health plans, similar to how they replaced pensions with retirement savings plans; move to high-deductable plans makes workers responsible for their own care, while employers hope plans will motivate employees to comparison-shop for medical services.
lead_paragraph: Just as employers replaced pensions with retirement savings plans, more large companies appear to be making a similar cost-sharing shift with health plans.

headline.main: High Health Plan Deductibles Weigh Down More Employees
headline.print_headline: High Health Plan Deductibles Weigh Down More Employees
